private_information: I am a truck
I can drive between places (depots and distributors)
I can carry crates when crates are loaded into me
I cannot lift crates or change clear status of surfaces
truck0.goal: Coordinate with hoists to move crates to achieve global stacking goals.

I can carry crates when crates are loaded into me
I cannot lift crates or change clear status of surfaces

private_information: I am a hoist
I stay at my assigned place
I can lift, drop, load, and unload crates at my place
I must be idle to start lifting and become busy when lifting
hoist0.goal: Use local lifting capabilities to support placement of crates to achieve global stacking goals.

private_information: I am a hoist

I must be idle to start lifting and become busy when lifting

private_information: I coordinate trucks and hoists to achieve the global goals
I will produce a PDDL domain and problem describing the integrated planning problem
orchestrator.goal: Generate a PDDL domain and problem that models trucks driving, hoists manipulating crates, surfaces that can be clear or not, crates that can be on surfaces or in trucks, and that achieves the global stacking goals respecting agent constraints.

public_information: Trucks are the only things that move between places.
Hoists stay at their assigned places and manipulate crates locally.
Surfaces are pallets or crates; crates are both movable items and surfaces.
A crate is clear if nothing is on top of it.

orchestrator.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems. You will be provided information about the environment and the capabilities and knowledge of the agents which interact in the environment. You always provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that describes the planning problem. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags, and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions for different agents distinct, so that there is no confusion as to which agent performs which action. Model trucks driving between places, hoists operating only at their place with idle/lifting states, crates as movable items and as surfaces, on/in relations, clear predicate, and ensure the goal stacking relations are achievable given initial state and agent constraints.
orchestrator.prompt:
Your name is orchestrator.
Initial information about the environment: {environment->init}.
Goal for the environment: {environment->goal}.
The public information is: {environment->public_information}.
The trucks' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->truck0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck2->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->truck3->private_information}.
The hoists' constraints are: {agents->agent_details->hoist0->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist1->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist2->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist3->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist4->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist5->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist6->private_information}, {agents->agent_details->hoist7->private_information}.
Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and problem that encapsulate the integrated model, respecting the constraints of each agent. Do not make assumptions beyond the given information. There is no need for anything else beyond producing the pddl files.
